{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3334656,"name":"Patrick Helman","username":"helmanps","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/50afbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-16T21:15:30.349Z","cooked":"

Hello again

We are trying to advance our autonomous abilities by being able to start from one of the angled speaker sides.

We have a few questions about how to do this:

  1. Should we set the initial angle in the starting point of the first trajectory? In the example below, the robot would know it starts at 30degrees and that it should be at 0 degrees (straight) after it moves?
  2. Do we need to also initialize the the gyro so it also knows the robot is starting at 30 degrees? What is the preferred way to do this?
Trajectory forwardCenterTrajectory =
        TrajectoryGenerator.generateTrajectory(
            
            new Pose2d(0, 0, new Rotation2d(0.524)),
            List.of(new Translation2d(1, 0)),
            new Pose2d(1.2, 0, new Rotation2d(0)),
            config);

A link to the code branch we are currently working on can be found here.

The help we’ve received from all of the contributors here has been amazing this year and has really helped us with our first year of swerve and command-based programming.

turn on the robot facing the direction of opponent. then align and reset pose but dont reset gyro. it should work.

Thank you for the suggestion!

Is it correct that the pose will be reset by the setPose in the autonomous command and we need to make sure that the angle we set in the trajectory initial Pose2d is the same as what the gyro will be reading when the robot is aligned (at an angle)?

addCommands(
        new AutonomousLauncherCmd(launcherSubsystem, 5000, conveyorSubsystem, 0.25, 2),

        new ParallelCommandGroup(
            new SequentialCommandGroup(
                new InstantCommand(() -> s_Swerve.setPose(forwardCenterTrajectory.getInitialPose())),
                forwardCenterSwerveControllerCommand,
                new InstantCommand(() -> s_Swerve.drive(new Translation2d(0, 0), 0, false, false))
            ),

public void setPose(Pose2d pose) {
    swerveOdometry.resetPosition(getGyroYaw(), getModulePositions(), pose);
  }```

I dont know. I used advantage kit and pathplanner. what I do know is we set pose of robot to the initial pose of the path. however, we reset pose before auto. we turn on robot and align with subwoofer and then press “b” to reset pose. it does not reset the rotation of the robot. when we enable auto, it will get the initial pose of the path and use that for the robot’s current pose.
